page.title: 04FARMING-HORTICULTURE.Headcor
page.content: { Horticulture}can be an expensive and risky business,even when sheltered by heat controlled greenhouses.Early{1985 was a bleak winter - snow and frost ruined many plants in local nurseries and market gardens causing consider- able loss.Beans,Lettuce,Tomatoes and other salad commodities are grown for marketing.In Summer months,soft fruits like{Strawberries}and{Raspberries}are also sent to market;one farm operates a"Pick-you-own"facility,selling direct to the public.{Vegetables,Flowers}and {Fruit}can often be bought at the road- side from places that have surplus crops,but the larger orchards have disappeared from this particular area. One nursery has about 7 acres covered by huge glasshouses growing flowers for London markets.The{Chrysanthemums} are carefully packed in cardboard boxes and despatched by British Rail.
